definition: victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: The quick, decisive victory that Napoleon expected never happened.
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑期盼着的速决速胜迟迟没有发生。

sentences.english: In this connection the excessive demands of the theorists of quick victory are wrong.
sentences.chinese: 速胜论者在这点上面的过分要求，也属不对。

sentences.english: In short words, this ideology was to get quick victory in Guangdong province.
sentences.chinese: 这种思路简言之，就是广东“速胜论”。

definition: to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
to wait at one's ease for the exhausted enemy/to nurture one's strength and bide one's time (idiom)
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to prevail/to achieve victory/to be victorious
to defeat decisively/to win decisively/great victory/triumph
to accomplish the whole task at one stroke (idiom)
pinyin: bi4 qi2 gong1 yu2 yi1 yi4

definition: using the weak to defeat the strong (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
locked in a stalemate/to confront one another
